channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Welcome to Weblorg
item.description: DONE Intro Weblorg is a Static HTML Website Generator. It’s built with Emacs Lisp and takes advantage of the powers of Org-Mode as the source format, and makes it easy to extend and customize the structure and the theme of the generated website. It’s easy to run Weblorg from a CI or from any other automated environment with emacs –script publish.el from the root of your website. DONE Templating To make it more natural for people that have used other tools for generating websites, Weblorg leverages templatel, a library that provides a familiar syntax for stitching reusable templates together for creating websites.

item.title: Journey
item.description: Small info/log on my linux journey and my experience. If you are reading this, I encourage you to write blogs like this and have it in your git repo. Don’t forget to tag or inform me, I’d be glad to read your journey too! tools section My Linux Journey My linux journey was from Linux Mint > EndeavourOS > Arch Linux > and now NixOS. Tbh I loved LM and Arch alot, I was a devotee to Arch too, and I hated Nix when I tried, cause things were weird.

item.title: Tools Nix-Org, A Simply Aesthetic, Productive setup with Declaration World! Just do enable=true;
item.description: Utilities that are Best! 🌟 Class Name Window Manager Hyprland 🌸 Text Editor Emacs 💮 Gtk Theme Gruvbox / Orchis 🎨 Font Comic Code / Comic Mono / Fira Code Pdf Reader Sioyek 📔 (ditch zathura) Media Player MPV! 🎬 (its MVP too) Image Viewer Imv 🖼️ RSS Reader Elfeed 📰 (Again, Emacs) Music Player Ncmpcpp or Mingus in Emacs 🎶 Terminal Foot via footclient ⚽ Menu/Launcher Bemenu 🚀 Notification Dunst 🛎️ Shell Zshell with Starship 🔰 Status Bar Waybar 🍥 Favourite Color-Schemes Modus-Vivendi + Gruvbox Rest all other stuffs I do in Emacs, tbh I could do everything in Emacs lol.
